page.title: 13FARMING IN CHAPEL-FRITH.
page.content: The old farm has been in the family for 95 years. It comprises ll0 acres of various soils,some of which are difficult to drain.Organic & chemical fertilisers are used & rainfall favours grass-growing for the dairy farmer.40 Fresians produce l70 gallons per day.E.E.C.quotas entail a 9% cut- back.Cattle are reared on the farms. The farmer works by himself using machinery but needs extra help at harvest time.Work begins at 0530 and finishes at l930.A balance between conservation & production is maintained by planting trees & hawthorn hedges. Major changes include oil lamps to electricity & horse power to machinery. The future plans of this successful farm are to provide holiday accommodation & increase sheep stock whilst decreasing cattle.
